intro: Pentacalia cuatrecasasiana, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or open habitats, often in areas with well-drained soil. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are arranged in dense clusters. This species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
